pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:0.5: 10. The training rule on digging the earth
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Āḷavī at the Aggāḷava Shrine.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.2: At that time the monks at Āḷavī were doing building work. And they dug the earth and got it dug.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.4: “How can the Sakyan ascetics dig the earth and get it dug?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.5: They are hurting life with one sense faculty.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.6: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.7: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.8: “How can those monks at Āḷavī dig the earth and get it dug?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.9: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.12: Foolish men, how can you dig the earth and get it dug?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.13: People regard the earth as conscious.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.14: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.15: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited thus:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.16: ‘If a monk digs the earth or gets it dug, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.4: … The monk who has been given the full ordination by a complete Sangha through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.6: there are two kinds of earth: productive earth and unproductive earth.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.8: pure soil, pure clay, with few stones, with few pebbles, with few potsherds, with little gravel, with little sand; mostly soil, mostly clay.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.9: If it is unburnt, it is also called “productive earth.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.10: A pile of soil or a pile of clay that has been rained upon for more than four months, this too is called “productive earth.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.12: just stones, just pebbles, just potsherds, just gravel, just sand, with little soil, with little clay; mostly stones, mostly pebbles, mostly potsherds, mostly gravel, mostly sand.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.13: If it is burnt, it is also called “unproductive earth.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.14: A pile of soil or a pile of clay that has been rained upon for less than four months, this too is called “unproductive earth.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.16: if he digs it himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.18: if he asks another, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.19: If he only asks once, then even if the other digs many times, he commits one offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.2.1: If it is earth, and he perceives it as earth, and he digs it or gets it dug, or he breaks it or gets it broken, or he burns it or gets it burnt, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.2.2: If it is earth, but he is unsure if it is, and he digs it or gets it dug, or he breaks it or gets it broken, or he burns it or gets it burnt, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.2.3: If it is earth, but he does not perceive it as earth, and he digs it or gets it dug, or he breaks it or gets it broken, or he burns it or gets it burnt, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.3.2: if he says, “Consider this”, “give this”, “bring this”, “there’s need for this”, “make this allowable;”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.3.7: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.3.8: The tenth rule, the training rule on digging the earth, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.3.9: The first sub-chapter on lying is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.3.13: Apart from one who understands, true,
